marketNews.title: Government Releases New Waste-to-Energy Regulation
marketNews.content:
President Prabowo Subianto released Presidential Regulation (Perpres) No. 109/2025 concerning the processing of waste into electrical energy (PSEL or waste-to-energy) on October 10, 2025. This new regulation has several important changes compared to the previous regulation, namely Perpres No. 35/2018. Here are some important points of difference (for a more complete comparison, see the table above): 
- Increase in Electricity Purchase Price by PLN. Perpres No. 109/2025 regulates the price of electricity purchased from PSEL operators by PLN at 20 US cents per kWh for all capacities, an increase compared to the previous regulation which ranged from ~13 US cents per kWh depending on the PSEL capacity. 
- Electricity Purchase and Sale Agreement Term of 30 Years. Perpres No. 109/2025 regulates the duration of the electricity purchase and sale agreement from PSEL operators to PLN for 30 years, calculated from when the relevant PSEL is declared to have reached a commercially operational stage. By comparison, the previous regulation did not regulate the duration of the electricity purchase and sale agreement between the PSEL operator and PLN. 
- Elimination of Tipping Fee. The increase in the electricity purchase price by PLN is accompanied by the elimination of the waste management fee scheme (tipping fee). By comparison, under the previous regulation, the PSEL operator received a tipping fee of a maximum of 500,000 rupiah per ton of waste, which was compensation for waste processing services. Apart from the changes contained in the table above, Perpres No. 109/2025 also regulates the role of Danantara in the implementation of PSEL projects, namely: 1) selecting the business entity to develop and manage the PSEL; and 2) carrying out investments in the implementation of PSEL that is viable commercially, financially, and in terms of risk management. The establishment of a PSEL operator itself can be carried out through cooperation between local governments with State-Owned Enterprises (BUMN), Regional-Owned Enterprises (BUMD), or private parties. Danantara CEO, Rosan Perkasa Roeslani, claimed on Thursday (16/10) that there are already 107 prospective investors for waste-to-energy projects in Indonesia, where 53 are domestic and 54 are foreign. Based on the analysis conducted by the Ministry of Environment, there are 10 cities ready to implement this project, namely Jakarta, Tangerang, Bekasi, Bandung, Yogyakarta, Semarang, Surabaya, Medan, Bali, and Makassar. Key Takeaway: The revenue source scheme based on the new regulation - with a higher purchase price from PLN despite no tipping fee - and the long electricity sales contract period have the potential to provide business certainty and increase the financial viability of PSEL projects. On the IDX, there are several issuers that already have and/or plan to have exposure in the waste-to-energy industry or its ecosystem, such as TOBA, OASA, MHKI, HGII, and BIPI.

marketNews.title: SMRA 9M25: Marketing Sales +34% YoY, Equivalent to 71% of 2025 Target
marketNews.content: SMRA: Summarecon Agung recorded marketing sales of 1.39 trillion rupiah in 3Q25 (+49% YoY, +8% QoQ). This result brought marketing sales during 9M25 to reach 3.57 trillion rupiah (+34% YoY), equivalent to 71% of the 2025 target of 5 trillion rupiah. The housing segment contributed 76.3% of marketing sales during 9M25, followed by shophouses (20%), apartments (1.9%), land plots (1.6%), and office and commercial (0.2%).

marketNews.title: Other Hot News You Need to Know
marketNews.content: The yield on 10-year Indonesian government bonds fell -6.6 bps to 5.956% on Thursday (16/10), marking the lowest level since January 2021. This yield decrease was driven by expectations of interest rate cuts and strong domestic demand for state debt securities. President Prabowo Subianto stated on Wednesday (15/10) that he had instructed Danantara to cut the number of State-Owned Enterprises from ~1,000 to ~200. President Prabowo also mentioned that the government has changed regulations to open opportunities for foreign professionals to lead our SOEs. Prabowo\'s nephew and President Director of PT Arsari Tambang, Aryo Djojohadikusumo, stated on Wednesday (15/10) that his company is discussing the acquisition of mining assets in Canada. Aryo did not specify the target assets to be acquired, but he mentioned that the transaction is valued around 7 trillion rupiah and is expected to be completed by June 2026. PT Arsari Tambang is a tin mining company that operates mainly in the Bangka Belitung region, according to Reuters reports. Kontan reported that heavy equipment manufacturer, LiuGong Indonesia, plans to establish a heavy equipment production facility worth 317 million US dollars in the Artha Industrial Hill Industrial Estate, Karawang Barat. This factory will have a production capacity of up to 5,000 units per year by 2030. Moreover, the Ministry of Industry noted that there are 2 other companies that have submitted investment commitments for factory expansion, namely: 1) PT Qingtuo Automotive Manufacturing Indonesia with an investment of 330 million US dollars; and 2) PT Komatsu Indonesia - an affiliate entity of UNTR - with an investment value of 13.5 million US dollars. Geoprima Solusi (GPSO) stated in clarification to the IDX that PT PIMSF Pulogadung will acquire 45.45% of the company\'s shares owned by the existing controller, Karnadi Margaka, at an average price of 67.66 rupiah per share or a total value of 20.5 billion rupiah. PT PIMSF Pulogadung had previously purchased 170 million GPSO shares at an average price of 59 rupiah per share on October 14, 2025, thus the direct ownership portion of PT PIMSF Pulogadung in GPSO increased from none to 25.49%. GPSO also mentioned that the company cannot yet confirm the prospective ultimate beneficial owner (UBO) of the company. However, based on the capital structure of PT PIMSF Pulogadung, the strongest prospective UBO of the company is Kurniawan Eddy Tjokro. Boston Furniture Industries (SOFA) announced that its subsidiary, PT Pratama Satya Prima, has added new business activities in waste management and electricity generation. Bloomberg reported that the government will impose a new levy on cocoa bean exports starting October 22, 2025, with rates ranging from 2.5-7.5%. This new levy will be paid to the Plantation Fund Management Agency, which will later be distributed as a support program for farmers to increase production. Meanwhile, the export duty rate for cocoa beans paid to Customs is reduced from a maximum of 15% to a maximum of 7.5%, so the total cost (export levy and export duty rate) paid from export levies and export duty rates remains at 15%.

marketNews.title: Gold Yield Trend: The World is Moving Towards Gold, A New System at the $IHSG
marketNews.content: "We may be witnessing the birth of a new era - \"The Gold Standard 2.0\" - where trust, not just monetary policy, is once again the most valuable currency." - VarelJoanK

tickerNews.title: FUTR Reaches Strategic Understanding with PLN Bali to Develop 130 MW Solar Power Plant Project
tickerNews.content: Futura Energi Global (FUTR) Director Tonny Agus Mulyantono said that the company has reached a strategic understanding with the Bali regional office of PT PLN to work on a 130 MW solar power plant (PLTS) project. Previously, FUTR explained to the IDX in a clarification that the company plans to develop a PLTS with a potential capacity of 130 MW in 2026. Tonny also mentioned that FUTR will soon sign a memorandum of understanding with a strategic partner from China in the solar energy technology and energy storage system field.

tickerNews.title: Petrosea Commissioner Erwin Ciputra Acquires 600,000 PTRO Shares, Increasing Stake to 0.1056%
tickerNews.content: Petrosea Commissioner, Erwin Ciputra, purchased 600,000 PTRO shares at an average price of 6,875 rupiah per share on October 15, 2025. The total transaction value reached ~4.1 billion rupiah. Following this transaction, Erwin Ciputra\'s ownership in PTRO increased from 0.0997% to 0.1056%.

tickerNews.title: PACK Sets Rights Issue Conversion Bond Execution Price at 100 Rupiah per Share, Potential Funds Up to 3.26 Trillion Rupiah
tickerNews.content: Abadi Nusantara Hijau Investama (PACK) announced that the execution price for the rights issue in the form of a mandatory convertible bond (OWK) is 100 rupiah per share. In this corporate action, PACK will issue a maximum of ~32.6 billion shares, so the maximum potential fund collection reaches 3.26 trillion rupiah. Every 5 PACK shares will receive 102 rights, with 1 right equivalent to 1 OWK. The maximum dilution effect from this corporate action reaches 95.33%. PACK\'s controller, PT Eco Energi Perkasa, stated it will execute all its rights and act as a standby buyer. The funds obtained will be used by PACK for loans to subsidiary entities for the purpose of paying for the purchase of shares of PT Konutara Sejati and PT Karyatama Konawe Utara, as well as working capital financing. The cum rights period in the regular and negotiated market is November 28, 2025, while the rights trading period is scheduled from December 4-10, 2025, and the conversion maturity date for the OWK into shares is December 17, 2026.

tickerNews.title: WIFI's Subsidiary Wins 1.4 GHz Frequency Auction for Java, Maluku, and Papua Regions; DSSA's Entity Wins Regions II and III
tickerNews.content: The Ministry of Communication and Digital on Wednesday (15/10) announced the winners of the 1.4 GHz frequency band auction. PT Telemedia Komunikasi Pratama, a business entity of Solusi Sinergi Digital (WIFI), won the right to utilize the 1.4 GHz frequency band for regional I which covers Java, Maluku, and Papua. Meanwhile, PT Eka Mas Republik (MyRepublic), a business entity of Dian Swastatika Sentosa (DSSA), obtained the rights for regional II and III.

tickerNews.title: Darma Henwa's Shareholder Sold 816 Million DEWA Shares, Ownership Drops to 6.07%
tickerNews.content: Darma Henwa shareholder, PT Madhani Talatah Nusantara, sold 816 million DEWA shares on October 10, 2025, at an average price of 75 rupiah per share. The total transaction value reached 61.2 billion rupiah. After this transaction, the direct ownership portion of PT Madhani Talatah Nusantara in DEWA decreased from 8.07% to 6.07%.

tickerNews.title: PIPA New Controller Plans Mandatory Tender Offer at 21 Rupiah per Share, Potentially Increasing Stake to 96.35%
tickerNews.content: Multi Makmur Lemindo\'s new controller, PT Morris Capital Indonesia, plans to conduct a mandatory tender offer for 47.47% of PIPA shares at an offer price of 21 rupiah per share. PIPA stated that this mandatory tender offer will last for 30 calendar days, starting 1 calendar day after the information disclosure announcement on October 15, 2025. After this corporate action is complete, the ownership of PT Morris Capital Indonesia in PIPA could potentially increase from 48.88% to 96.35%. This corporate action follows the completion of the acquisition by PT Morris Capital Indonesia of 43.78% of PIPA shares at an average price of 10.6 rupiah per share or a total value of 15.9 billion rupiah on October 10, 2025. PT Morris Capital Indonesia plans to develop PIPA as part of the national energy distribution ecosystem, covering BBM trading and logistics.

tickerNews.title: Boston Furniture Industries (SOFA) Subsidiary Adds New Business Activities in Waste Management and Electricity Generation
tickerNews.content: Boston Furniture Industries (SOFA) announced that its subsidiary, PT Pratama Satya Prima, has added new business activities in the field of waste management and electricity generation.

tickerNews.title: GPSO Clarifies Acquisition: PT PIMSF Pulogadung to Buy 45.45% of Shares from Existing Controller, Kurniawan Eddy Tjokro Strongest UBO Candidate
tickerNews.content: Geoprima Solusi (GPSO) stated in clarification to the IDX that PT PIMSF Pulogadung will acquire 45.45% of the company\'s shares owned by the existing controller, Karnadi Margaka, at an average price of 67.66 rupiah per share or a total value of 20.5 billion rupiah. PT PIMSF Pulogadung had previously bought 170 million GPSO shares at an average price of 59 rupiah per share on October 14, 2025, thus the direct ownership portion of PT PIMSF Pulogadung in GPSO increased from none to 25.49%. GPSO also mentioned that the company has not yet been able to confirm the prospective ultimate beneficial owner (UBO) of the company. However, based on the capital structure of PT PIMSF Pulogadung, the strongest prospective UBO of the company is Kurniawan Eddy Tjokro.
